Articles.Content:
Currently Kerbals have a variety of animations in the window / IVA, like the wonderful "do a jig", "look around", "slow whoa", "clap hands", etc..

(I checked the 'already suggested' and the 'do not suggest' lists and there didn't seem to be anything on kerbal animations)

I'm suggesting another three that occur when faced with imminent danger depending on their various stupid / brave / badass settings. (I'll leave that to the devs to work out those occurrence frequency settings). I post this only to get a better sense from my kerbonauts on how my flying/rocketing is going.

- rapidly wave hands in front of themselves (in panic of rapidly approaching surface) ie nononononononononononNOOOOOOO!

- covers face with hands

- crosses arms and look smug / wink

low priority I know, but it would be cool to see at some point down the track.

Edited June 19, 2014 by wile1411
I checked for previous suggestions
Yeah, while those are pretty low priority in the overall scheme of things, they could certainly be nice-to-have final touches to the game.

- crosses arms and look smug / wink

I highly approve.

Any improvement to Kerbal interactivity will be welcome polish to the final game.
in certain capsules highfives would be cool. or highfours.
